channel.title: Changing Any Password From Command Prompt
channel.description:
Ok well this is quite simple. First off let me tell you what this does. This will let you change the password of any user on a computer (including administrator) without having to know the previous password. This is useful for hacking people computers and pissing off people at school. Note that this is for learning purposes or tweaking your own computer only. I take no responsibility for any trouble you get in for doing this.
Step 1.
Open up the start menu and press "run." Ok now in the little text box type in "cmd" (without quotes).
Step 2.
A window will pop up. Now in this type "Net User" (without quotes). Not a list of usernames will pop up. Choose the one you want to change the pass to.
Step 3
Dont know if you need to do this or not, but now type in "net user (name of the user)" without quotes or perenthesies. Ok now a large list of data will pop up about the user.. You can ignore all this.
Step 4.
Ok not type in (i am going to use the username "bob" for example) "Net User Bob *" ok type that in without any perenthesies (make sure u keep the aterisk!!!!)
Step5.
Now it will ask you what you want the new password to be. Type anything in. (if you don't see anything get typed in when you type, do not wory, this is normal). It will ask you to repeat the password again. Ok not log out and try to log into the account with old passowrd. Then try with new password and you will see that it worked. Have fun :)
Credits: Me

@vbcoderx wrote:

lol, there isn’t a need for teh * you can just do

Net User username password
